intro: Bertiera zaluzania, commonly known as Mexican firebush, is a shrub native to Mexico and Central America. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its vibrant orange-red flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant has simple, alternate leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in dry, open habitats. Bertiera zaluzania is also valued for its ornamental appeal and ability to attract pollinators.
